title: Derived traits show up when const-generics ordered improperly
body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

I tried this code:

```rust
#![feature(const_generics)]
#![allow(incomplete_features)]

#[derive(Debug)]
pub struct Example<const N: usize, T>([T; N]);
```

I expected to see this happen: It should've errored out, only complaining about incorrect order of types and consts. 

Instead, this happened: It also caught the derive statement in the error:


### Meta
<!--
If you're using the stable version of the compiler, you should also check if the
bug also exists in the beta or nightly versions.
-->

I ran this on playground with nightly and beta:
```
Nightly version: 1.47.0-nightly

(2020-08-01 05762e3d6f5facafdd47)

Beta version: 1.46.0-beta.2

(2020-07-23 6f959902b3103c49ca98)
```

<!--
Include a backtrace in the code block by setting `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` in your
environment. E.g. `RUST_BACKTRACE=1 cargo build`.
-->
There is no backtrace since it returns a valid error, but the error is just unexpected. The error outputs are as follows:

Beta:
```
  Compiling playground v0.0.1 (/playground)
error: type parameters must be declared prior to const parameters
 --> src/main.rs:7:36
  |
7 | pub struct Example<const N: usize, T>([T; N]);
  |                   -----------------^- help: reorder the parameters: lifetimes, then types, then consts: `<T, const N: usize>`

error: type parameters must be declared prior to const parameters
 --> src/main.rs:6:10
  |
6 | #[derive(Debug)]
  |          ^^^^^ help: reorder the parameters: lifetimes, then types, then consts: `<T: ::core::fmt::Debug, const N: usize>`

error[E0554]: `#![feature]` may not be used on the beta release channel
 --> src/main.rs:1:1
  |
1 | #![feature(const_generics)]
  | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

error[E0747]: constant provided when a type was expected
 --> src/main.rs:6:10
  |
6 | #[derive(Debug)]
  |          ^^^^^
  |
  = note: type arguments must be provided before constant arguments
  = help: reorder the arguments: types, then consts: `<T, N>`
  = note: this error originates in a derive macro (in Nightly builds, run with -Z macro-backtrace for more info)

error: aborting due to 4 previous errors
```

Nightly:
```
   Compiling playground v0.0.1 (/playground)
error: type parameters must be declared prior to const parameters
 --> src/main.rs:7:36
  |
7 | pub struct Example<const N: usize, T>([T; N]);
  |                   -----------------^- help: reorder the parameters: lifetimes, then types, then consts: `<T, const N: usize>`

error: type parameters must be declared prior to const parameters
 --> src/main.rs:6:10
  |
6 | #[derive(Debug)]
  |          ^^^^^ help: reorder the parameters: lifetimes, then types, then consts: `<T: ::core::fmt::Debug, const N: usize>`

error: aborting due to 2 previous errors

error: could not compile `playground`.
```
